item.title: Debugging Python C/C++ Extensions
item.author: nikhilweee@gmail.com (Nikhil Verma)
item.description: Over the past few weeks I’ve been using OpenSpiel, an RL framework for research on games. Like a lot of popular Python frameworks built for speed, OpenSpiel is also written in C++ with functionality exposed in Python through C++ bindings1. Although the framework has documentation available, it’s not possible to document everything and besides, nothing beats stepping through the code in a debugger like the built-in pdb or the TUI based pudb (which happens to be my favourite).
